0.user_question: The solutions of the equation $z^4+4z^3i-6z^2-4zi-i=0$ are the vertices of a convex polygon in the complex plane. 1.subquestion: What are the roots of the equation $z^4+4z^3i-6z^2-4zi-i=0$?

subanswer.text: Finding the roots requires solving a system of equations formed by equating the real and imaginary parts of the polynomial's coefficients to zero separately. 1.subquestion: What is the value of $|z|$ for any solution of the equation $z^4+4z^3i-6z^2-4zi-i=0$?

subanswer.text: To determine this, we look at the modulus (absolute value) of the equation. That is, if $|w| = r$, then $|w^k| = r^k$ for any nonnegative integer $k$. So we have $|z|^4 = |i|$ since $i$'s absolute value is 1. Thus $|z| = 1$. This means that every vertex of our polygon lies on the unit circle in the complex plane. The answer is 1.
